full_summary:
### New Vehicle Access Tender Announcement

#### Solicitation Number
2023-00996

#### Publication Date
July 11, 2023

#### Tender Closing Date
August 14, 2023 at 2:00 PM

The Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) invites eligible contractors to submit bids for the New Vehicle Access project, a construction contract to provide a new access driveway to the existing CFIA Port of Entry Inspection Station in Emerson, Manitoba.

#### Contract Details

- **Contract Value**:.Value of the contract: CAN $X (to be specified in the addendum)
- **Contract Duration**:. Work is to commence on August 16, 2023, and will be substantially completed by March 31, 2024.

The contract includes providing new pavement segments, new gates, relocating site signage, and related work.

#### Bidder Participation

- **Site Visit**: A site visit will take place on July 20, 2023, at 10:00 a.m. Interested bidders must meet at the Emerson-Noyes Point of Entry in Emerson, Manitoba.
- **Bidder's Conference**: A bidder's conference will be held on July 27, 2023, at 10:00 a.m. via MS Teams. Invitations will be sent to all potential bidders. The conference will review the scope of the project and address any questions.

#### Bid Submission

- **Bid Receiving**: Bids must be submitted to the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) Bid Receiving by the tender closing date at 2:00 p.m.
- **Contact Information**: For more information, please contact Ashley Bennett at (343) 553-9512 or Ashley.Bennett@inspection.gc.ca.

#### Trade Agreements

This tender is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

#### Attachments

The relevant tender notices and related documents are available on the Canadabuyss website.

This tender is for a project that will provide a new access driveway to the CFIA Port of Entry Inspection Station in Emerson, MB. The project includes providing new pavement segments, new gates within the existing fence, relocating the site signage, and related work. Interested bidders who want to submit a bid should contact Ashley Bennett and follow the instructions for the bidder's conference.
